column3: Ugh, I really don't want to rehash the arguments given previously.\n\nIf users are hitting the chain limits with any frequency they should be fixed-- their justification in the first place was that ignoring apparent attacks they weren't being hit.  Failing to make payments due to inexplicable internal machinery when otherwise payment making never fails can lead to funds loss and accidental fraud
> Failing to make payments due to inexplicable internal machinery\n\nIt will eventually fail regardless because the wallet doesn't count non-mempool change, no?
